Mr. Selfridge
Drama
['As creditors close in, can Harry seal the deal that will save his mercantile empire? Jeremy Piven stars in Mr. Selfridge, dramatizing the climactic battle for the future of London’s iconic department store, Selfridge & Co.']

profile:
The user exhibits a pronounced enthusiasm for high-quality storytelling, recently reaffirmed by a perfect 5.0 rating for a drama that broadened their understanding of urban life and political complexity. This interaction maintains their historical average rating at 4.8, reflecting their discerning taste for nuanced narratives characterized by well-developed characters and intricate themes. They have a strong commitment to character-driven storytelling, particularly narratives that delve into personal and socio-political contexts.

Consistently opting for English audio and subtitles, the user enhances their viewing experience, demonstrating a preference for immersive storytelling. While they remain open to exploring various genres, they prioritize quality, character engagement, and thoughtful direction. Their admiration for acclaimed directors is evident, as they gravitate towards works that feature complex and rich storytelling.

This latest interaction not only reinforces their passion for meaningful narratives and compelling performances but also highlights their continued interest in content that deepens their understanding of characters and their environments. The user actively seeks out intricate and character-driven narratives that meet their elevated standards, affirming their position as a discerning viewer dedicated to the appreciation of profound storytelling.
